ID: Daily-Mail_2024-04-06_Greta-Thunberg-is
Source: Daily-Mail
Title: #DS Greta Thunberg is detained twice by Dutch police during protest over fossil fuel in The Hague - as a video shows the moment two burly cops dump the Swedish climate activist on a coach #DE
Subtitle: #DS Thunberg and a group of marchers blocked a main road on Saturday. #DE
Content: #DS #PH #CS Greta Thunberg was detained by police officers on Saturday in the Netherlands (Alt: The image shows police officers in high-visibility yellow vests detaining a young woman in a light-colored hoodie. Two officers are escorting her, with one on each side. In the background, there are crowds of people and what appears to be protest activity on a street or road area.) #CE
Greta Thunberg was detained twice by Dutch police during a protest over fossil fuel in The Hague. Video footage shows the moment two burly cops dumped the climate activist on a coach.The incident happened on Saturday after Thunberg and a group of marchers blocked a main road in a protest organised by the Extinction Rebellion group. She had joined hundreds of protesters on a walk down from The Hague's city centre to the A12 arterial highway that connects the seat of the Dutch government with other cities including Amsterdam, Rotterdam and Utrecht.Dozens of police officers, including some on horseback, blocked the group from accessing the motorway, warning that 'violence could be used' should the marchers try to get onto the road. #DE #MS They were carrying environmental group flags and placards saying 'Stop fuel subsidies now!' and 'The planet is dying!'. #ME #DS The chanting protesters were then locked in a tense standoff with police who formed a wall of law enforcement. Thunberg joined in with the chants and slogans during the protest. #DE
#DS #PH #CS The arrest happened after she joined a group of marchers and blocked a main road in a protest organised by the Extinction Rebellion group (Alt: The image shows two Dutch police officers in high-visibility yellow vests detaining a young woman in a light-colored top on a street. The officers are escorting her while a white car passes by in the background. Red brick buildings line the street, and the scene appears to be taking place during a street protest.) #CE #DE
#MS 'It's important to demonstrate today because we are living in a state of planetary emergency,' Thunberg told AFP as police blocked marchers. 'We must do everything to avoid that crisis and to save human lives,' she said. #ME #DS Some activists found another route and blocked a main road close to the highway where they - including Thunberg - sat down on the tarmac. #DE #MS Asked whether she was concerned about police action and arrest, Thunberg said: 'Why should I be?' #ME #DS Thunberg was arrested and dragged away by police to a waiting touring bus where she was detained with other activists. #DE #MS She told the ANP national news agency by telephone that her arrest had proceeded 'calmly'. 'It's not about the arrest. I am here for the climate,' she said. #ME #DS A spokesman for the Public Prosecutor's Office confirmed the protesters were briefly detained before being released. #DE
#DS #PH #CS She had joined hundreds of protesters on a walk down from The Hague's city centre, in the Netherlands (Alt: The image shows police officers in high-visibility yellow vests detaining several protesters who are sitting on a road. Multiple officers are present, with some bending down to interact with the seated demonstrators. A blue car is visible in the background, along with brick buildings. The protesters appear to be blocking the street as part of their demonstration.) #CE #DE
